item.title: 2000 Players - Winterlove
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Ehhh, from what I can tell, this will not allow you to have 2,000 players, nor will it improve server performance. The lag isn’t caused by not being able to accept new clients fast enough, it’s caused by player updating and lots of client IO threads. It’s a pretty neat design idea (I was using a similar system for servers a few years back), but ultimately it doesn’t do much for your server because this is not where the performance bottleneck lies.

It increases stability because your class has exception handling, so that if an exception occurs while the PlayerHandler process method is running, it will catch the exception and the thread wont terminate. In the old implementation (without the Executor), the thread would just die and the server would crash. This is decent, except that you aren’t actually multi-threading the PlayerHandler processing (because you use a single thread for the logic executor).

tl;dr:
In my opinion, this does effectively stabilize your server, but it does not increase performance very much.

[quote=“Canownueazy, post:5, topic:361257”][quote author=T3arful link=topic=457541.msg3348469#msg3348469 date=1285025856]
Won’t this just allow you to accept connections faster?
[/quote]Exactly. The reason your Winterlove servers crash is because it only has 1 acceptor. So estimating 1 connection per second. If 500 people are trying to connect at once it will take 500 seconds (which is about 8 minutes) but the server is too flooded to distinguish which connection to handle first. Also this has a seperate multi threader so process for players is on a seperate thread. You can do the same to other “processes”[/quote]
The crash is actually caused by the PlayerHandler thread (the main one) crashing. This is why most of the time a server crashes, you log in, get a black screen, log out, and it says you’re already logged in if you try to log in again. You wouldn’t be able to log in at all if the acceptor was offline. The client disconnects because the it times out when it doesn’t receive a player update packet. Also, I would say it’s more accurate for a server to be able to accept a connection in less than a millisecond.

I’m not trying to bring you down or anything man, just giving you some constructive and helpful criticism. Don’t take it personally.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

[quote=“Canownueazy, post:35, topic:361257”][quote author=jmood128 link=topic=457541.msg3366519#msg3366519 date=1286834505]

[quote author=Canownueazy link=topic=457541.msg3366358#msg3366358 date=1286824440]

[quote author=surfer25 link=topic=457541.msg3353644#msg3353644 date=1285565609]

what do guys use to test how many players there server can hold? link to download the bot, post, website, ect. anything of that would be nice =]
[/quote]Bot’s aren’t the same as normal players, so it’s not an accurate testing.

they still send packets though.

It’s the update block that throws the accuracy off.
Bots don’t need the update block as all they do is spam.

Spaming chat still uses the updateblock because it needs to be shown to all the local players.
[/quote]^ this

You still didn’t even re write Player Updating so the server still will never be able to hold 2000 players, the only reason it could hit 1000 is because it looks like your using a 12+ core server with high RAM.
[/quote]It had 16GB of RAM and 8 cores but we could hold 2000 on 4GB RAM and 4 cores so…?[/quote]

I actually went on your server and spoke to a few of your staff.

A lot of them said that the most you had ever had on was about 500. I think the highest any member I spoke to said was ~1000. You sir are not only a fraud but also a liar.

And you are just on a super powerful vps. The code in InnovationX is fucking shit and it is all in one client.

Read full topic

item.title: 2000 Players - Winterlove
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“rain1994, post:23, topic:361257”][quote author=I Vain I link=topic=457541.msg3350766#msg3350766 date=1285286609]

what do guys use to test how many players there server can hold? link to download the bot, post, website, ect. anything of that would be nice =]
[/quote]Bot’s aren’t the same as normal players, so it’s not an accurate testing.

i know that… players walk,talk, do commands, and teleport wich cause lag. But I would still like to know the program so i can try it…[/quote]

It more or less the player updating problem, all WL based servers handle player updating poorly and that is what causes the biggest lag.

This is also do nothing, if you re wrote your player updating to work with this then I would see how it would help. But this isn’t really doing much of anything else.

item.title: 2000 Players - Winterlove
item.dc:creator: @surfer25 surfer25
item.description:
@surfer25 wrote:

Thread pools wont magically make your program run better. You still haven’t fixed the threading issues such as synchronization/deadlocks etc. Are you running the thread-per-connection model? If so you wont get 2000 players. How are you running tasks? Still the retarded way of

private int lawl = 0;
if(lawl > 0)
    lawl--;

Then your program will still suck due to poor design. And I doubt you’ve fixed the issue whereby a player can spam packets and cause the rest of the players to fail to update and cause lag, just because of winterloves poor design.

[quote=“Rixxx, post:18, topic:361257”][quote author=Scape-JAVA link=topic=457541.msg3350147#msg3350147 date=1285210590]

I agree he obviously leeched it. Post that reply asap

I heard he pays people to program things for him, then he claims it as his, THEN he releases it as a tutorial.
[/quote]
Kinda true or he would have explained the code he wrote.

Edit: I read this same thread on R-S and you don’t even know what a benchmark is?[/quote]

There isn’t much to explain, he added Thread pools for the socket accepting and the player process method has been scheduled in a ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.

Read full topic
